meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of both commercial and non-commercial activities.
meanings.sent1: The small bakery had a semicommercial approach, selling homemade goods alongside branded products.
meanings.sent2: The art exhibition had a semicommercial vibe, showcasing local artists' work for sale.
meanings.sent3: The semicommercial nature of the charity event made it a unique blend of fundraising and community celebration.
meanings.sent4: Her semicommercial mindset was like a bridge connecting the business world with the non-profit sector.
meanings.sent5: The semicommercial concept was as intriguing as a puzzle waiting to be solved.

meanings.definition: Involving some commercial aspects but not fully commercial.
meanings.sent1: The semicommercial lease agreement allowed for limited commercial activities in the residential building.
meanings.sent2: The online platform operated on a semicommercial basis, offering free services with optional paid upgrades.
meanings.sent3: The semicommercial event had attendees guessing whether it was a business gathering or a social gathering.
meanings.sent4: His semicommercial venture was like a hybrid between a hobby and a business.
meanings.sent5: The semicommercial setup was as flexible as a rubber band, stretching to accommodate different needs.
